title: Tattooed Millionaire (song)
text: "Tattooed Millionaire" is the first single from <a href="Bruce%20Dickinson">Bruce Dickinson</a>'s debut solo album, "<a href="Tattooed%20Millionaire">Tattooed Millionaire</a>". It was released on 11 April 1990. "Tattooed Millionaire" reached number 18 on the <a href="UK%20Singles%20Chart">UK charts</a>. The promotional video was directed by <a href="Storm%20Thorgerson">Storm Thorgerson</a>. According to "Ultimate Classic Rock", the song is about "celebrity tabloid rockers". A 1990 review published in "<a href="The%20Georgia%20Straight">The Georgia Straight</a>", says the song "takes a not-so-subtle stab at the excesses of the L.A. rock ’n’ roll lifestyle, particularly that led by <a href="Vince%20Neil">Vince Neil</a> and his Motley gang". <a href="Nikki%20Sixx">Nikki Sixx</a> has stated that the song is about him, inspired by Dickinson's then-wife cheating on him with Sixx and then Dickinson finding out about it after reading "<a href="The%20Dirt">The Dirt</a>", though that is doubtful since "Tattooed Millionaire" was released eleven years before "The Dirt" was published.
